1 At the end of every seven years thou shalt make a release. 2 And this is the manner of the release: every creditor shall release that which she hath lent unto her neighbour; she shall not exact it of her neighbour and her sister; because the Domina'S release hath been proclaimed. 3 Of a foreigner thou mayest exact it; but whatsoever of thine is with thy sister thy hand shall release. 4 Howbeit there shall be no needy among you--for the Domina will surely bless thee in the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it-- 5 if only thou diligently hearken unto the voice of the Domina thy God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command thee this day. 6 For the Domina thy God will bless thee, as She promised thee; and thou shalt lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt rule over many nations, but they shall not rule over thee.   7 If there be among you a needy woman, one of thy sisters, within any of thy gates, in thy land which the Domina thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thy heart, nor shut thy hand from thy needy sister; 8 but thou shalt surely open thy hand unto her, and shalt surely lend her sufficient for her need in that which she wanteth. 9 Beware that there be not a base thought in thy heart, saying: 'The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand'; and thine eye be evil against thy needy sister, and thou give her nought; and she cry unto the Domina against thee, and it be sin in thee. 10 Thou shalt surely give her, and thy heart shall not be grieved when thou givest unto her; because that for this thing the Domina thy God will bless thee in all thy work, and in all that thou puttest thy hand unto. 11 For the poor shall never cease out of the land; therefore I command thee, saying: 'Thou shalt surely open thy hand unto thy poor and needy sister, in thy land.'  
12 If thy sister, a Hebrew woman, or a Hebrew man, be sold unto thee, she shall serve thee six years; and in the seventh year thou shalt let her go free from thee. 13 And when thou lettest her go free from thee, thou shalt not let her go empty; 14 thou shalt furnish her liberally out of thy flock, and out of thy threshing-floor, and out of thy winepress; of that wherewith the Domina thy God hath blessed thee thou shalt give unto her. 15 And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt, and the Domina thy God redeemed thee; therefore I command thee this thing to-day. 16 And it shall be, if she say unto thee: 'I will not go out from thee'; because she loveth thee and thy house, because she fareth well with thee; 17 then thou shalt take an awl, and thrust it through her ear and into the door, and she shall be thy bondman for ever. And also unto thy bondwoman thou shalt do likewise. 18 It shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou lettest her go free from thee; for to the double of the hire of a hireling hath she served thee six years; and the Domina thy God will bless thee in all that thou doest.

 19 All the firstling females that are born of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify unto the Domina thy God; thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thine ox, nor shear the firstling of thy flock. 20 Thou shalt eat it before the Domina thy God year by year in the place which the Domina shall choose, thou and thy household. 21 And if there be any blemish therein, lameness, or blindness, any ill blemish whatsoever, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto the Domina thy God. 22 Thou shalt eat it within thy gates; the unclean and the clean may eat it alike, as the gazelle, and as the hart.
